com.vernalis.knime.mmp.fragmentors

Class ROMolFragmentFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vernalis.knime.mmp.fragmentors.ROMolFragmentFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MoleculeFragmentationFactory

    public class ROMolFragmentFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements MoleculeFragmentationFactory

    This class provides a number of factory methods for fragmenting a molecule. A molecule can be fragmented multiple times by calling the relevant fragmentation method with different BondIdentifier(s).

    The main factory method, #fragmentMolecule(Set), will attempt to perform the fragmentation in the quickest available manner

    The class is thread-safe and performs it's own garbage clean-up of RDKit objects. The user must, however, clean up the supplied ROMol object after use

    Author:
    s.roughley <knime@vernalis.com>

      • fragmentMolecule

        public MulticomponentSmilesFragmentParser fragmentMolecule(BondIdentifier bond,
                                                  boolean treatProchiralAsChiral)
                                                    throws MoleculeFragmentationException,
                                                           java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: MoleculeFragmentationFactory
        This is the method to fragment a molecule by breaking a single bond. This method is called by #fragmentMolecule(Set) if the set only contains 1 bond
        Specified by:
        fragmentMolecule in interface MoleculeFragmentationFactory
        Parameters:
        bond - The bond to be broken
        treatProchiralAsChiral - If a molecule has not chiral centres (either defined or undefined), should chirality be generated at prochiral centres?
        Returns:
        The fragmentation result
        Throws:
        MoleculeFragmentationException - If unable to correctly fragment
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the bond is null

      • fragmentMolecule

        public MulticomponentSmilesFragmentParser fragmentMolecule(java.util.Set<BondIdentifier> bonds,
                                                  boolean treatProchiralAsChiral)
                                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                           MoleculeFragmentationException
        Description copied from interface: MoleculeFragmentationFactory
        The main method for fragmentations. This method delegates single bond breaks to #fragmentMolecule(BondIdentifier), and then for 2 or more breaks determines whether any atom is shared by two breaking bonds. In this latter case, #fragmentLong(Set) is called, as separate RWMol copies are required for each component. Otherwise, #fragmentShort(Set) is used.
        Specified by:
        fragmentMolecule in interface MoleculeFragmentationFactory
        Parameters:
        bonds - The bond or bonds to be broken
        treatProchiralAsChiral - If a molecule has not chiral centres (either defined or undefined), should chirality be generated at prochiral centres?
        Returns:
        The fragmentation result
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no bonds are supplied
        MoleculeFragmentationException - If unable to correctly fragment

      • fragmentMoleculeWithBondInsertion

        public MulticomponentSmilesFragmentParser fragmentMoleculeWithBondInsertion(BondIdentifier bond,
                                                                   boolean treatProchiralAsChiral)
                                                                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                            MoleculeFragmentationException
        Description copied from interface: MoleculeFragmentationFactory
        This is the method to fragment a molecule by breaking a single bond 'twice'. The result is the outcome of the transformation: 
         A-B >> A-[*:1] . B-[*:2] . [*:1]-[*:2]
        Specified by:
        fragmentMoleculeWithBondInsertion in interface MoleculeFragmentationFactory
        Parameters:
        bond - The bond to be broken
        treatProchiralAsChiral - If a molecule has not chiral centres (either defined or undefined), should chirality be generated at prochiral centres?
        Returns:
        The fragmentation result
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the bond is null
        MoleculeFragmentationException - If unable to correctly fragment
